Best trails in Zion National Park

# Best trails in Zion National Park

5 alerts

·

## 4.5(228,527 reviews)

·

## [United States](https://www.alltrails.com/us "United States")  :   \#2 of 60 [national parks](https://www.alltrails.com/us/national-parks "National Parks")

[All photos](https://www.alltrails.com/parks/us/utah/zion-national-park/photos)

Zion National Park is Utah's first national park, and the most visited of Utah's Mighty 5. Zion Canyon is the centerpiece and most popular part of the park. Zion Canyon was carved by the Virgin River over millions of years! You might know Zion by its bucket-list hikes — Angels Landing and the Narrows are two of the most popular — but you don't have to be an experienced hiker to soak in the epic scenery Zion has to offer. Our guide includes a day hike for everyone, whether you're looking for a family-friendly stroll along the river or a heart-pounding climb with the canyon sprawling below you.

There are 5 areas where you can hike in Zion: [Zion Canyon](https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/zion-canyon-trail-descriptions.htm), [East Rim](https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/east-rim-wilderness-trail-descriptions.htm), [Kolob Canyons](https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/kolob-canyons-wilderness-hiking-trails.htm), [Kolob Terrace](https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/kolob-terrace-wilderness-trail-descriptions.htm), and [Southwest Desert](https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/southwest-desert-wilderness-hiking-trails.htm). The most popular and easily accessible hikes are in the Zion Canyon area. The other areas are wilderness areas that offer more rugged hikes. It takes a little extra effort to travel to those areas, but the reward is fewer fellow hikers on the trail.

From March through November, the park runs [2 free shuttle routes](https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/zion-canyon-shuttle-system.htm), the Zion Canyon Line and the Springdale Line. The Zion Canyon Line operates within the park, with shuttle stops near popular trailheads. The Springdale Line operates outside the park, with stops at locations in the town of Springdale and at Zion Canyon Village. You don't need a ticket or reservation to ride the shuttles — just hop on and off at any shuttle stop. Remember that when the shuttles are in operation, you can't drive a personal vehicle along Zion Canyon Scenic Drive, but you can still drive to other areas of the park.

Zion is open 24 hours a day, year-round. Spring and fall are the best times to visit for the mildest weather, but the park is beautiful all year. If you visit from March through November, remember that most of the hikes in Zion Canyon are only accessible via the free park shuttle.

There is an [entrance fee](https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/fees.htm) to visit Zion. You can only purchase an entrance pass in person at one of the park's entrance stations.

## Top trails

01. ### [\#1 \- Angels Landing Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/angels-landing-trail)



    [4.9(37559)\\
    \\
    ·Strenuous\\
    \\
    ·4.7 mi](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/angels-landing-trail "Angels Landing Trail") [The Angels Landing Trail is a technical route in Zion National Park with steep drop-offs, scrambles, and very narrow sections. Though it is protected by chains in many sections, the final push to the landing is considered Class 3 terrain due to the exposure, short steep scrambles, and steep drop-offs on either side. The incredible views of Zion Canyon make this hike the most popular in Zion.\\
    \\
    You'll start by parking at The Grotto Trailhead or taking the West Rim Shuttle to The Grotto shuttle...](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/angels-landing-trail "Angels Landing Trail")

02. ### [\#2 \- Scout Lookout via West Rim Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/scout-lookout-trail)



    [4.9(17964)\\
    \\
    ·Hard\\
    \\
    ·3.8 mi\\
    \\
    ·Est. 2.5–3 hr](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/scout-lookout-trail "Scout Lookout via West Rim Trail") [This is a popular paved trail that leads up to Scout Lookout. Despite the pavement, the trail can be very steep and difficult in some sections. It is also quite exposed, so visiting in either the morning or late afternoon will provide some shade.\\
    \\
    After crossing the Virgin River on a bridge, the trail turns right and follows the river for a bit. Then, it starts climbing on a paved trail. The views of the canyon become incredible along the way, offering great photo opportunities. After a...](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/scout-lookout-trail "Scout Lookout via West Rim Trail")

03. ### [\#3 \- The Watchman Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/the-watchman-trail)



    [4.7(20837)\\
    \\
    ·Moderate\\
    \\
    ·3.3 mi\\
    \\
    ·Est. 1.5–2 hr](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/the-watchman-trail "The Watchman Trail") [The Watchman Trail in Zion National Park is an easy and well-maintained trail that is often overlooked by hikers. Many others are going to the neighboring trails and often pass by this hike in Zion. It overlooks the entire Springdale area and is ideal for beginner hikers. \\
    \\
    The Watchman trailhead parking lot is the closest classic hike to the south entrance of the park, only half a mile away.\\
    \\
    The trail starts as a steady incline up moderate switchbacks leading to great views of the area at...](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/the-watchman-trail "The Watchman Trail")

04. ### [\#4 \- Emerald Pools via Kayenta Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/kayenta-trail-to-the-emerald-pools)



    [4.5(6921)\\
    \\
    ·Moderate\\
    \\
    ·2.5 mi\\
    \\
    ·Est. 1.5–2 hr](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/kayenta-trail-to-the-emerald-pools "Emerald Pools via Kayenta Trail") [This hike takes you to the Emerald Pools. It is one of the alternate paths to the pools via the Kayenta Trail. The Kayenta Trail takes you alongside the Virgin River, and the terrain is sandy and rocky. There are long drop-offs and sandstone steps on the trail. The views of Zion Canyon are stunning as you make your way toward the lower, middle, and upper pools. This trail is crowded on a nice day, and swimming is not allowed at Emerald Pools.](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/kayenta-trail-to-the-emerald-pools "Emerald Pools via Kayenta Trail")

05. ### [\#5 \- Floating Rock via Zion Narrows Riverside Walk](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/elephant-temple-via-riverside-walk)



    [4.9(14749)\\
    \\
    ·Moderate\\
    \\
    ·6.4 mi\\
    \\
    ·Est. 3.5–4 hr](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/elephant-temple-via-riverside-walk "Floating Rock via Zion Narrows Riverside Walk") [This section of the Zion Narrows Riverside walk takes you to the Floating Rock feature, situated just under two peaks: Imlay Temple and Elephant Temple. This route continues into the Narrows past the end of the maintained trail. A trip through Utah’s most famous slot canyon is unlike any other typical day hike. You’ll be walking in between towering canyon walls alongside the beautiful Virgin River. The river’s water level does vary and those who choose to continue past the end of this route...](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/elephant-temple-via-riverside-walk "Floating Rock via Zion Narrows Riverside Walk")

06. ### [\#6 \- The Zion Narrows Riverside Walk](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/the-zion-narrows-riverside-walk)



    [4.6(14641)\\
    \\
    ·Moderate\\
    \\
    ·2.1 mi\\
    \\
    ·Est. 1–1.5 hr](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/the-zion-narrows-riverside-walk "The Zion Narrows Riverside Walk") [Planning a trip to Zion to hike The Narrows should be on every outdoor enthusiast's bucket list. This route along the Riverside Walk Trail is a relatively easy and paved out and back located at the end of the Zion Canyon Scenic Drive. This route only includes the maintained trail. Those looking for a longer adventure can find the full Zion Narrows route that continues down the river past this trail's endpoint. There is water and a restroom at the trailhead. You’ll also have access to sandy...](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/the-zion-narrows-riverside-walk "The Zion Narrows Riverside Walk")

07. ### [\#7 \- Zion Canyon Overlook Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/canyon-overlook-trail)



    [4.8(14439)\\
    \\
    ·Easy\\
    \\
    ·1.0 mi\\
    \\
    ·Est. 0.5–1 hr](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/canyon-overlook-trail "Zion Canyon Overlook Trail") [The Canyon Overlook Trail offers some of the most breathtaking views of Zion Canyon. Located in the Upper East Canyon portion of the park, the trail is actually one of the few official trails in the area. This unfortunately means that the shuttle does not stop at this trailhead. To do this hike, you must enter the park in a private vehicle.\\
    \\
    You’ll be able to see the overlook from the switchbacks on Route 9. After going through the tunnel, the trailhead parking area is on your right. Parking...](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/canyon-overlook-trail "Zion Canyon Overlook Trail")

08. ### [\#8 \- Emerald Pools Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/emerald-pools-trail)



    [4.5(6682)\\
    \\
    ·Moderate\\
    \\
    ·3.0 mi\\
    \\
    ·Est. 1.5–2 hr](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/emerald-pools-trail "Emerald Pools Trail") [Emerald Pools Trail is a paved trail to Lower Emerald Pool which then leads to a rocky trail to the Upper Emerald Pool at the base of a cliff.\\
    \\
    This trail starts from Zion Lodge and crosses the bridge to a paved trail that leads to the Lower Emerald Pool and waterfalls. There are multiple pools here to soak up the sun and enjoy the variety of local flora and fauna. There are beautiful views of the valley but sometimes the water level in the pools can be low. The trail is well-maintained and...](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/emerald-pools-trail "Emerald Pools Trail")

09. ### [\#9 \- Emerald Pools and Zion Lodge via Kayenta Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/kayenta-trail-to-the-emerald-pools-and-zion-lodge)



    [4.6(7054)\\
    \\
    ·Moderate\\
    \\
    ·2.3 mi\\
    \\
    ·Est. 1–1.5 hr](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/kayenta-trail-to-the-emerald-pools-and-zion-lodge "Emerald Pools and Zion Lodge via Kayenta Trail") [This trail is commonly done as a point-to-point trail in either direction, depending on which shuttle stop you decide to start and end with.\\
    \\
    To get to this trail, you will need to take the shuttle. You can start or end at either the Grotto or the Zion Lodge shuttle stops.\\
    \\
    The route follows the Kayenta Trail to the lower and upper Emerald Pools, where you can also enjoy great views of Zion.](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/kayenta-trail-to-the-emerald-pools-and-zion-lodge "Emerald Pools and Zion Lodge via Kayenta Trail")

10. ### [\#10 \- Zion Narrows Bottom Up to Big Springs](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/zion-narrows-trail-to-imlay-temple-and-big-spring)



    [4.9(6062)\\
    \\
    ·Hard\\
    \\
    ·9.1 mi](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/zion-narrows-trail-to-imlay-temple-and-big-spring "Zion Narrows Bottom Up to Big Springs") [The Narrows is one of the most iconic day hikes in Zion National Park named for being the most narrow spot in Zion Canyon. As you hike through the blue water in the gorge, you will look up at rocky canyon walls a thousand feet tall as you walk through the Virgin River. Water levels can vary from ankle deep to chest high, and as with all slot canyons, caution should be used and the weather forecast should be checked.\\
    \\
    The most popular time to hike the narrows is late spring and summer when the...](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/zion-narrows-trail-to-imlay-temple-and-big-spring "Zion Narrows Bottom Up to Big Springs")

## Trail reviews for Zion National Park

203,002 trailgoersBusiest in October

[Petra + Lutz Haberzettl](https://www.alltrails.com/members/lutz-haberzettl)

Yesterday·Hiking

Not crowdedGreat conditionsGreat views

It’s one of the under appreciated trails in **Zion National Park**. It has beautiful views and very few people hiking it. At the end one can add the Emerald Pools to make a bit more strenuous and catch them in the afternoon light.

Difficulty:Easy

[Petros Tsampas](https://www.alltrails.com/members/orthodoxos-aderfos)

Dec 10, 2025·Hiking

Easy to parkNot crowdedBathrooms availableDog-friendlyGreat conditionsGreat views

This was the most beautiful trail we have done so far, with beautiful landscapes and the element water is very present alongside the path making it magical. The entrance inside the Mt **Zion National Park** is 35euro for each car, and it is valid for 7 days. The trail depicted on AllTrails, unfortunately it calculated from our start from our hotel in Springdale. So we have to subtract about 5.7miles.

Parking:Entry fee, Free, Large lot

[Emerald Pools Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/emerald-pools-trail)

[Petros Tsampas](https://www.alltrails.com/members/orthodoxos-aderfos)

Dec 10, 2025·Hiking

Easy to parkNot crowdedBathrooms availableDog-friendlyGreat conditionsGreat views

This great trail, is the first one on Mt **Zion National Park**. It is an easy trail, there are some parts with lots of stairs and rocky paths with a minimum level of difficulty. Great views from the top and the river down low is gorgeous.

[The Watchman Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/the-watchman-trail)

[Andrea Olive](https://www.alltrails.com/members/andrea-olive)

Dec 10, 2025

Easy to parkNot crowdedGreat conditionsGreat views

We thought this was stunning. The view at the end is spectacular- you look down in **Zion National Park** from 7000ft elevation. Breathtaking. But the walk itself was also enjoyable. Smooth trail that was easy to follow. Yes, a little bit of elevation up and down but nothing crazy. So quiet and peaceful. Wilderness experience!

[Cable Mountain via Stave Spring Trailhead](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/cable-mountain-via-stave-spring-trailhead)

[Toni Marie](https://www.alltrails.com/members/pika-chu-3)

Dec 10, 2025

Great views

Bucketlist hike in the **Zion National Park**. Brought my trekking pole which I was very grateful to have it. It was a 10 mile hike crossing the river against the current and the river rocks can be very slippery and saw a few people slip. Most stops at the “Wall Street” but we continued maybe a mile more. Water level can go up at waist level in certain areas and saw some with waterproof cover for their backpack which was really nice. This is a very crowded place but very fun. A must next to Angel’s landing but that one requires a permit and this does not.

[Zion Narrows Bottom Up to Big Springs](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/zion-narrows-trail-to-imlay-temple-and-big-spring)

[Gabby Tatman](https://www.alltrails.com/members/gabby-tatman)

Dec 6, 2025·Hiking

Hike #2 at **Zion National Park**

[Lower Emerald Pool Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/lower-emerald-pool-trail)

## Frequently asked questions

### Where is the best place to hike in Zion National Park?

According to users from AllTrails.com, the best place to hike in Zion National Park is [Angels Landing Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/angels-landing-trail), which has a 4.9 star rating from 37,559 reviews.This trail is 4.7 mi long with an elevation gain of 1,738 ft.

### What is the longest trail in Zion National Park?

According to AllTrails.com, the longest trail in Zion National Park is [Zion Traverse: Lee Pass to East Rim Trailhead](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/zion-traverse-lee-pass-to-east-rim-trailhead--2).This trail is estimated to be 50.3 mi long.

### How many trails are in Zion National Park?

There are 110 trails in Zion National Park.These trails have an average 4.5-star ratingfrom NaN AllTrails community reviews.

### Which trail has the most elevation gain in Zion National Park?

[Zion Traverse: Lee Pass to East Rim Trailhead](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/zion-traverse-lee-pass-to-east-rim-trailhead--2) has the most elevation gain with 8,467 ft of total ascent.The park's runner-up is [East Rim Trail to Mystery Canyon](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/eastrim-trail-to-mystery-canyon), which has 7,759 ft of elevation gain.

### Are there camping trails available in Zion National Park?

According to AllTrails.com, there are 20 camping trails in Zion National Park and the most popular is [The Watchman Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/the-watchman-trail) with an average 4.7 star rating from 20,837 community reviews.

### Are there running trails available in Zion National Park?

According to AllTrails.com, there are 11 running trails in Zion National Park and the most popular is [The Watchman Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/the-watchman-trail) with an average 4.7 star rating from 20,837 community reviews.
